official-title.#text: To amend the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act to allow State child protective services systems better to serve the needs of children who are victims of trafficking, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Strengthening the Child Welfare Response to Trafficking Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Strengthening the Child Welfare Response to Trafficking Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: State plans to serve child victims of trafficking

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 106 of the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act/s:106
Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act/s:106/ss:b/p:2/sp:B
Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act/s:106/ss:b/p:2/sp:B/cl:xxii

text.#text: by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 103(15) of the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000/s:103/p:15

text.#text: provisions and procedures to identify and assess reports involving child trafficking (as described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and services available to address their needs, including those provided by State law enforcement, juvenile justice, and social service agencies such as runaway and homeless youth shelters to serve this population; and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act/s:106/ss:b/p:2/sp:B/cl:xxiv

text.#text: provisions and procedures for training child protective services workers about identifying children who are victims described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , by adding at the end the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act/s:106/ss:d

text.#text: The number of children determined to be a victim of each type of trafficking described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000/s:103/p:9/sp:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: (B) of section 103(9) of the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000/s:103/p:9/sp:B

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 111 of the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act/s:111

text.#text: by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act/s:3/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , a child shall be considered a victim of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act/s:111/ss:a/p:4

quote.#tail: if the child is identified, by a State or local agency employee of the State or locality involved, as a victim of trafficking (as described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 103(15) of the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000/s:103/p:15

text.#text: Except as otherwise provided in this section, the amendments made by this Act shall take effect on the date that is 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines requires State legislation (other than legislation appropriating funds) in order for the plan to meet the additional requirements imposed by this Act, the State plan shall not be regarded as failing to comply with the requirements of such section solely on the basis of the failure of the plan to meet such additional requirements before the 1st day of the 1st calendar quarter beginning after the close of the 1st regular session of the State legislature that ends after the 1-year period beginning with the date of the enactment of this Act. For purposes of the preceding sentence, in the case of a State that has a 2-year legislative session, each year of the session is deemed to be a separate regular session of the State legislature.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text: In the case of an approved State plan under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 106(b) of the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act/s:106/ss:b

header.#text: Delay permitted if State legislation required
